thread.title: How J-Rock Star Shishido Kavka Took New York Fashion Week at ADEAM
thread.title_full: How J-Rock Star Shishido Kavka Took New York Fashion Week at ADEAM

title: How J-Rock Star Shishido Kavka Took New York Fashion Week at ADEAM

organizations.name: star shishido kavka took new york fashion week

text: Meet the J-Rock Star Whose Striking Look Just Took New York Fashion Week February 10, 2017 11:01 PM 1 / 11 Ready for my flight to New York City. Courtesy of Shishido Kavka On the first day of New York Fashion Week , beneath the stunning high-vaulted ceilings at the Refectory Room, Shishido Kavka made an unforgettable runway debut at ADEAM . The cult Japanese rock singer closed the show striding barefoot down the catwalk in a gothic black gown with her waist-grazing hair swinging loosely behind her. She then marched to a drum kit to perform one of her showstopping percussive sets. It was a pitch-perfect finale for designer Hanako Maeda’s deeply heartfelt 5-year anniversary collection. Kavka is not only a true musical talent, but a bona fide beauty muse, with much credit due to her distinctive long, high-gloss hair, which she whips wildly around when performing. “I’ve always kept it long,” she says—but she doesn’t fuss too much over it. “My hair is my signature, so I try to keep my routine minimal.” Here, an inside look at that pre-show routine and the rest of Shishido’s 48-hour whirlwind schedule—this is how a Fashion Week breakout is born.
